title: What will happen to the kinetic energy when the object is massless and when velocity is zero? - Quora

response.answer_text: By definition, if an object is massless, then it does not exist as matter, therefore it is not an object. It could just be an energy phenomenon, but by the definition of kinetic energy it is not ke. Philosophy or science? Just felt the need to say something.

Massless particles move with the speed of light and cannot be stopped , only absorbed or emitted like in case of photons. Neutrinos are almost massless and for this reason already at small energy have relativistic speeds. Massless particles can’t be stopped
